value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to train a model and register it in a workspace.

value.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results.

value.excerpt: Perform speech translation tasks with the speech service to translate spoken text to different languages.

value.excerpt: Use unsupervised learning methods to predict groupings in data. Use variations of k-means clustering and spectral clustering to analyze and visualize difficult data sets.

value.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore modern data warehouse analytics in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamentals of database concepts in a cloud environment, get basic skilling in cloud data services, and build your foundational knowledge of cloud data services within Microsoft Azure. You will explore the processing options available for building data analytics solutions in Azure. You will explore Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure HDInsight.

topItems.title: Examine components of a modern data warehouse
topItems.excerpt: Examine the components of a modern data warehouse. Understand the role of services like Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure HDInsight. See how to use Azure Synapse Analytics to load and process data.

images.title: Examine components of a modern data warehouse

topItems.title: Explore data ingestion in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Explore the different data ingestion options available when you are building a data warehouse with Azure. See how to use Azure Data Factory to ingest data into a data warehouse.

images.title: Explore data ingestion in Azure

topItems.title: Explore data storage and processing in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Explore Azure services for performing data analytics, and explore the features of Azure Synapse Analytics.

images.title: Explore data storage and processing in Azure
Examine components of a modern data warehouse

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore non-relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamentals of database concepts in a cloud environment, get basic skilling in cloud data services, and build your foundational knowledge of cloud data services within Microsoft Azure. You will explore non-relational data offerings, provisioning and deploying non-relational databases, and non-relational data stores with Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure Table Storage, Azure Blob Storage, Azure File Storage, and Azure Cosmos DB, and explore situations for using them.

images.title: Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure

topItems.title: Explore provisioning and deploying non-relational data services in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to provision and configure Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Lake , Azure Blob Storage, and Azure File Storage.

images.title: Explore provisioning and deploying non-relational data services in Azure

topItems.title: Manage non-relational data stores in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to upload and retrieve data held in Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Blob storage, and Azure File storage.

images.title: Manage non-relational data stores in Azure
Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure

value.title: Cloud administration basics
value.excerpt:
Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types of services, in preparation for real-world cloud practice on Azure.
In this learning path, you will:

Learn about the history of the cloud, and how it was built
Know the major cloud providers and cloud types
Understand what types of resources are available through the cloud
Recognize cloud service modules
Know the economic benefits of the cloud
Understand digital identity, and how digital identities can be shared and secured

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for administrators
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types on your way to becoming a Cloud Administrator.

images.title: Foundations of cloud computing for administrators

topItems.title: Provision and manage cloud services
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different types of resources available on the cloud and the technology behind how they work.

images.title: Provision and manage cloud services

topItems.title: Secure your cloud resources with access control
topItems.excerpt: Learn about digital identities and how they can be managed and synchronized within an organization.

images.title: Secure your cloud resources with access control
Foundations of cloud computing for administrators

value.title: Evaluate text with Azure Cognitive Language Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Cognitive Language Services to analyze text, determine intent, detect adult themes, and process natural language input.

topItems.title: Classify and moderate text with Azure Content Moderator
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to implement text moderation with the Azure Content Moderator service.

images.title: Classify and moderate text with Azure Content Moderator

topItems.title: Add conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to adding conversational intelligence to your apps by using language understanding (LUIS)

images.title: Add conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)

topItems.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
topItems.excerpt: Learn what your customers are really saying about your product or brand when they send feedback. We'll create a solution that uses Azure Functions and the intelligence of the Text Analytics API to discover sentiment in text messages.

images.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
Classify and moderate text with Azure Content Moderator

value.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI in government
value.excerpt: It is imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in government. In this learning path, you will be provided with guidelines to assist in setting up principles and a governance model in your government organization. You will also be provided with resources, best practices, and tools.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we’ve recognized six principles that we believe should guide AI development and use — fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability. For us, these principles are the cornerstone of a responsible and trustworthy approach to AI, especially as intelligent technology becomes more prevalent in the products and services we use every day. We recognize that every individual, company, and region will have their own beliefs and standards that should be reflected in their AI journey. We want to share our perspective as you consider developing your own guiding principles.

images.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government
topItems.excerpt: As AI becomes more prevalent, it’s imperative that governments have practices in place to ensure that it’s used responsibly. This starts with governments establishing their own guiding principles, then choosing and operationalizing a system of governance. We recognize that every government will have their own perspective on responsible AI, but we’re hopeful that our perspective will serve as a helpful starting point as they embark on their own AI journey.

images.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI in government

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we have established our own governing practices for responsible AI. While every organization will have its own approach and we don’t have all the answers, we’d like to share what we’ve learned so far.

images.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

value.title: Identify principles and practices for responsible AI
value.excerpt: It is imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in business. In this learning path, you will be provided with guidelines to assist in setting up principles and a governance model in your organization. You will also be provided with resources, best practices, and tools.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we’ve recognized six principles that we believe should guide AI development and use — fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability. For us, these principles are the cornerstone of a responsible and trustworthy approach to AI, especially as intelligent technology becomes more prevalent in the products and services we use every day. We recognize that every individual, company, and region will have their own beliefs and standards that should be reflected in their AI journey. We want to share our perspective as you consider developing your own guiding principles.

images.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: As AI becomes more prevalent, it’s imperative that organizations have governing practices in place to ensure that it’s used responsibly. Responsible use of AI starts with organizations establishing their own guiding principles, then choosing and operationalizing a system of governance. We recognize that every organization will have their own perspective on responsible AI, but we’re hopeful that our perspective will serve as a helpful starting point as others embark on their own AI journey.

images.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we have established our own governing practices for responsible AI. While every organization will have its own approach and we don’t have all the answers, we’d like to share what we’ve learned so far.

images.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

value.title: Introduction to AI technology for business leaders
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you will be provided with a high-level overview of the primary concepts of AI. You will be able to describe what AI happens to be and the technologies that underpin it. You will be able to share  how Microsoft is turning the latest advancements in AI into tools, products, and services that can be leveraged by organizations.

topItems.title: Introduction to AI technology
topItems.excerpt: This module provides a high-level overview of the primary concepts of AI and the technologies behind it. We then dive into how Microsoft is turning the latest advancements in AI into tools, products, and services that can be leveraged by organizations.

images.title: Introduction to AI technology

topItems.title: Examine the Microsoft approach to artificial intelligence
topItems.excerpt: This module is a starting point for business decision makers who want to understand how Microsoft is creating products, services, and solutions to help organizations leverage Artificial Intelligence (AI). We’ll also help you understand how these technologies relate to business problems.

images.title: Examine the Microsoft approach to artificial intelligence
Introduction to AI technology

value.title: Manage cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring it's underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.
In this learning path, you will:

Learn about virtualization and how it's used in the cloud
Know what VMs and containers are
Understand what scale, load, and common load patterns are
Know what autoscaling is and be familiar with autoscaling techniques
Learn how to automate cloud resource management with scripts
Understand the concept of infrastructure-as-code

In Partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
topItems.excerpt: Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

images.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity

topItems.title: Automate cloud resource management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about how to automate cloud resource management with scripts and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.

images.title: Automate cloud resource management

value.title: Process and Translate Speech with Azure Cognitive Speech Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement the Speech services found in Azure Cognitive Services by performing speech-to-text transcription, synthesizing text input to speech, performing speech translation, and implementing speaker recognition in your AI infused applications.

topItems.title: Transcribe speech input to text
topItems.excerpt: Speech-to-text from the speech service,  known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

images.title: Transcribe speech input to text

topItems.title: Synthesize Text Input to Speech
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to synthesize text to speech using the Speech-to-Text service.

images.title: Synthesize Text Input to Speech

topItems.title: Translate speech with the speech service
topItems.excerpt: Perform speech translation tasks with the speech service to translate spoken text to different languages.

images.title: Translate speech with the speech service
Transcribe speech input to text

value.title: Optimize compute costs on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
value.excerpt: Explore some strategies that you can use on Azure to optimize your cloud-native application development process using Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

value.title: Azure Kubernetes Service Workshop
value.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy a multicontainer application to Kubernetes on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

images.title: Azure Kubernetes Service Workshop

value.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks
value.excerpt: Create an Azure Notebook and use three popular Python libraries to analyze climate data collected by NASA, then share it.

images.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks

value.title: Analyze images with the Computer Vision service
value.excerpt: The Computer Vision service enables software engineers to create intelligent solutions that extract information from images; a common task in many artificial intelligence (AI) scenarios.

images.title: Analyze images with the Computer Vision service

value.title: Analyze receipts with the Form Recognizer service
value.excerpt: Processing invoices and receipts is a common task in many business scenarios. Increasingly, organizations are turning to artificial intelligence (AI) to automate data extraction from scanned receipts.

images.title: Analyze receipts with the Form Recognizer service

value.title: Dynamically meet changing web app performance requirements with autoscale rules
value.excerpt: Respond to periods of high activity by incrementally adding resources, and then removing these resources when activity drops, to reduce costs.

images.title: Dynamically meet changing web app performance requirements with autoscale rules

value.title: Automate DevOps processes by using GitHub Apps
value.excerpt: Get started with GitHub in about an hour.

images.title: Automate DevOps processes by using GitHub Apps

value.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
value.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

images.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
value.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence

value.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
value.excerpt: A successful AI strategy must consider cultural issues as well as business issues. Becoming an AI-ready organization requires a fundamental transformation in how you do things, how employees relate to each other, what skills they have, and what processes and principles guide your behaviors. This unit is designed to help you understand which are the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and proposes a framework to drive that change in your organization.

images.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture

value.title: Capture and view page load times in your Azure web app with Application Insights
value.excerpt: Application Insights is an Azure service that you can use to  monitor the behavior and performance of a web application. If you run  a web app in Azure, you can take advantage of several benefits provided  by Application Insights simply by enabling it, without changing any of  your code. When you complete this module, you'll know how to enable  Application Insights and client-side monitoring and view metrics in the  portal.

images.title: Capture and view page load times in your Azure web app with Application Insights

value.title: Characterize DevOps Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement
value.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement.

images.title: Characterize DevOps Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement
